description:
I will present a sample web application inspired from the real world (so
not an application doing hello worlds) and showcase several ways of
scaling it up, layer after layer, doing benchmarks at every step, up to
1000 queries per second — or 86.4 millions per day — on one Amazon
server.

We will talk about:

-  stateful vs stateless
-  web servers and process managers
-  WSGI, AWSGI
-  asynchronicity
-  different sort of caches for different sort of things
-  various system hacks on Linux
-  monitoring
title: Scaling Python to 1K QPS per server, not doing Hello Worlds
